text: Balsamorhiza serrata (serrate balsamroot) is a North American species of plants in the sunflower tribe within the aster family. ==Distribution== The plant is native to the Western United States, including the Great Basin region. It has been found in Washington, Oregon, northern Nevada, and the Modoc Plateau in Modoc County of northeastern California. ==Description== Balsamorhiza serrata is an herb up to 30 cm (12 inches) tall. Leaves have teeth along the edges, hence the name "serrata." It has yellow flower heads, usually borne one at a time, with both ray florets and disc florets.Nelson, Aven & Macbride, James Francis 1913. Botanical Gazette 56(6): 479 ==References== serrata Category:Flora of California Category:Flora of Nevada Category:Flora of Oregon Category:Flora of Washington (state) Category:Flora of the Great Basin Category:Endemic flora of the United States Category:Plants described in 1913 Category:Taxa named by Thomas Nuttall
title: Balsamorhiza serrata
